paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the G628S mutation in the KCNH2 gene, its functional effects, and its implications in Long QT Syndrome.

functional_data.summary: The G628S mutation results in non-functional channels that dominantly suppress wild-type hERG1 current.

variants.segregation_data: The G628S mutation is associated with Long QT Syndrome and shows dominant-negative effects.
variants.additional_notes: The G628S mutation was primarily characterized in the context of hERG1a and hERG1b isoforms.
key_quotes: hERG1a-G628S channels have been found to be non-functional and to dominantly suppress wild-type hERG1 current.
The dominant-negative suppression of hERG1 current by the mutant hERG1a and hERG1b channels is clearly shown.

extraction_metadata.notes: The paper primarily focused on the G628S mutation in KCNH2 without additional variants.
